1.title: Kevin Spacey - Suicides
1.plot: How can talking with friends and adults help kids at risk for suicide? Thoughts from House of Cards star Kevin Spacey.

2.title: Jared Leto - Stand Up for Yourself
2.plot: Actor and musician Jared Leto tells a story of standing up to his bullies, even though he was small. Find out what he suggests other targets might try.

3.title: Michael J. Fox - Social Media
3.plot: What question does Michael J. Fox tell his kids to ask themselves before posting anything online?

4.title: Elizabeth Banks - Just Say No
4.plot: As a kid she was bullied to the point where she felt like she was physically in danger. Find out what actress Elizabeth Banks wishes someone had done to help.

5.title: Jamie Lee Curtis - Sitting Next to Someone
5.plot: How can you help without saying anything at all? A solution from award-winning actress and author Jamie Lee Curtis.

6.title: Akon - It's Not About You
6.plot: Singer / songwriter Akon, who emigrated from Africa as a child, shares his story about feeling and looking different in a new country.

7.title: Salma Hayek - Don't Give Them Power
7.plot: Do the bully's words have any real power? Advice from actress and producer Salma Hayek.

8.title: Demi Lovato - New Kid
8.plot: What happens when you reach out to a new kid at your school? Thoughts from multi-platinum recording artist Demi Lovato.

9.title: Laura Dern - Sense of Self
9.plot: What happens to bullying if we all grow comfortable with our own weaknesses? Thoughts from Fault in Our Stars actress Laura Dern.

10.title: Ansel Elgort - Popularity Helps
10.plot: Are you at a time where you have plenty of friends at school? Advice on how you can help from Fault in Our Stars actor Ansel Elgort.

11.title: Lily Collins - Being the New Kid
11.plot: Actress Lily Collins recalls how much it meant when a classmate invited her to sit with her during an assembly on her first day of high school.

12.title: Nina Dobrev - Gossip and Rumors
12.plot: How can you confront someone if rumors are being spread about you or a friend? Advice from Vampire Diaries star Nina Dobrev.

13.title: Jenna Elfman - Great Minds
13.plot: Know anyone who is bullied or isolated because they act different? Thoughts from actress Jenna Elfman on what you'd find if you strike up a conversation.

14.title: Jason Collins - Speak Up
14.plot: How can it help to approach a bully privately after the incident? And what can you say? Advice from NBA player Jason Collins.

15.title: Lawrence Kasdan - One Person
15.plot: He was a scared kid on his first day at a new school. Find out how one person changed things for the award-winning screenwriter of Star Wars and Raiders of the Lost Ark.

16.title: Melissa Joan Hart - Cliques
16.plot: Why step out of your clique and get to know someone new? Thoughts from actress Melissa Joan Hart.

17.title: Chad Smith - Girl Bully
17.plot: Red Hot Chili Peppers drummer Chad Smith shares a story of a girl who picked on him in middle school and beat him up in front of a crowd. Find out what he thinks his friends could have done to help.

18.title: Missy Franklin - Bigfoot
18.plot: She got singled out and teased about her body. Find out what Olympic gold medalist Missy Franklin realized in middle school that made it easier.

19.title: Olivia Holt - Who to Trust
19.plot: What makes a true friend? Thoughts from actress Olivia Holt.

20.title: Neil Gaiman - Don't Become Them
20.plot: Ever think about fighting back against cyberbullying? A caution from best-selling author and screenwriter Neil Gaiman.

21.title: John Green - Being Bullied
21.plot: He was dumped in a trashcan, picked up and jerked around. It was scary and dehumanizing and happened often to him in middle school. What finally helped? A story and solution from the best-selling author of The Fault in Our Stars.

22.title: Wayne Gretzky - Everyone's an Equal
22.plot: Hockey legend Wayne Gretzky became an NHL captain at age 22. Find out how he created an environment where every player was treated as an equal.

23.title: Jason Mraz - Atone
23.plot: What can you do if you've hurt someone? Singer and songwriter Jason Mraz talks directly to bullies about regret.

24.title: Kenny Ortega - Being Different
24.plot: How can you cope with the challenges of being different? Advice from award-winning director and choreographer Kenny Ortega.

25.title: Amanda Palmer - Be an Example
25.plot: What did singer / songwriter Amanda Palmer's teachers say to her that made a difference?

26.title: Danica Patrick - It Doesn't Matter
26.plot: What can you do when cliques exclude you or groups pick on you? Advice from auto racing driver Danica Patrick.

27.title: Raghava KK - Art
27.plot: Super powers. Gutsy deeds. Venting frustrations. Shrinking problems. Find out what let this world-famous artist and cartoonist have all these things during the days he was being bullied.

28.title: Gavin de Becker - Fear and Courage
28.plot: What fear do the bully, the target, and the bystander all have in common? How can we find the courage to take action? Advice from the nation's leading expert on the prediction and management of violence.

29.title: Tony Robbins - Kids Are the Most Powerful
29.plot: Motivational speaker and author Tony Robbins shares the story of a boy in Connecticut who was bullied because of his physical differences. Find out what creative solution the peewee football team came up with to protect him from harassment.

30.title: George Stroumboulopoulos - Being Different
30.plot: Ever feel alone? Know someone who seems isolated by their differences? Thoughts from award-winning Canadian talk show host George Stromboulopoulos.

31.title: Sam Trammell - Difference Is an Asset
31.plot: Are you ever afraid to express your differences? True Blood star Sam Trammell was. Find out what advice he has for his own kids.

32.title: Colum McCann - Band Together
32.plot: Worried you'll bring the bullying on yourself or make the situation worse if you step in? A solution from award-winning author Colum McCann.

33.title: Kevin Spacey - Not Weird, Unique
33.plot: What key message from friends and mentors was most helpful to actor Kevin Spacey when he was being singled out for being different? Hear the words he thinks saved him.

34.title: Jared Leto - Get Offline
34.plot: What can you do if you're being cyberbullied or having a tough time online? Solutions from actor and musician Jared Leto.

35.title: Elizabeth Banks - Save a Life
35.plot: Thoughts on suicide prevention from actress Elizabeth Banks.

36.title: Jamie Lee Curtis - Hurt People
36.plot: Can it help to know what's going on inside the bully? Thoughts from award-winning actress Jamie Lee Curtis.

37.title: Salma Hayek - Gossip
37.plot: Actress Salma Hayek shares her thoughts on gossip as a habit.

38.title: Demi Lovato - Internet
38.plot: Do you find yourself tempted to look at negative stuff online? Solutions from multi-platinum recording artist Demi Lovato.

39.title: Lily Collins - Positive Social Media
39.plot: What kind of spaces can we create online where teens feel safe and supported? How would it help? Thoughts and ideas from actress Lily Collins.

40.title: Nina Dobrev - Don't Perpetuate It
40.plot: Actress Nina Dobrev gets cyberbullied all the time. Find out how she deals with it.

41.title: Jenna Elfman - Set a Good Example
41.plot: What happens when you do something courageous? Advice from actress Jenna Elfman.

42.title: Jason Collins - Advice for Kids
42.plot: Why is it important to accept people for who they are? Advice from NBA player Jason Collins.

43.title: Melissa Joan Hart - Don't Justify the Rumor
43.plot: Should you dignify a rumor by defending yourself? Thoughts on handling gossip from actress Melissa Joan Hart.

44.title: Chad Smith - Say Hi
44.plot: What are some simple things you can say and do to make a new kid feel more comfortable? Suggestions from Red Hot Chili Peppers drummer Chad Smith.

45.title: Missy Franklin - Support and Get Help
45.plot: What are the two key categories of help a target of any kind of bullying needs from friends? Advice from Olympic gold medalist Missy Franklin.

46.title: Olivia Holt - Internet
46.plot: What can you do when you see a hurtful message online? Find out what actress Olivia Holt does, and when she thinks it's important to ask for help.

47.title: Neil Gaiman - Just Walk Away
47.plot: What can you do when people are cruel to you at school or online? Advice from best-selling author and screenwriter Neil Gaiman.

48.title: John Green - Empathy and Story
48.plot: How can thinking about your favorite books help? Thoughts from the best-selling author of The Fault in Our Stars.

49.title: Wayne Gretzky - Say Something
49.plot: Hockey legend Wayne Gretzky offers two ways to speak up and intervene when you witness bullying.

50.title: Jason Mraz - Give 'Em Love
50.plot: When singer and songwriter Jason Mraz sees cyberbullying on his site, he deletes it. What does he recommend when you see it elsewhere online?

51.title: Kenny Ortega - We Can Survive It
51.plot: He triumphed after years of beatings and harassment in his neighborhood and at school. Thoughts on human strength and advice for targets from award-winning director and choreographer Kenny Ortega.

52.title: Amanda Palmer - Disarm with Love
52.plot: What can you say to a bully that might actually make a difference? Advice from singer / songwriter Amanda Palmer.

53.title: Danica Patrick - Say Something Nice
53.plot: Ever wished you could help but not felt safe or comfortable speaking up when someone was getting picked on? Thoughts on really easy ways to help from auto racing driver Danica Patrick.

54.title: Raghava KK - Dealing with Bullies
54.plot: A group of older kids took him outside school alone to make fun of the work he loved. Find out what this world-famous artist and cartoonist said to his high school bullies.

55.title: Gavin de Becker - Elliot
55.plot: After repeated physical attacks by a much larger boy, a high school student wrote his will and took a gun to school. What action may have prevented this? Advice from the nation's leading expert on the prediction and management of violence.

56.title: Tony Robbins - Lead the Third Side
56.plot: Would bullying and gossip happen if bystanders didn't quietly watch or listen? How quickly can you change things if you interrupt it? Advice from motivational speaker and author Tony Robbins.

57.title: Kevin Spacey - It Only Takes One
57.plot: What if adults aren't helping? Who should step in? And how can you do it safely? Thoughts on how to help the target and the bully from House of Cards star Kevin Spacey.

58.title: Jared Leto - Say Hi
58.plot: Growing up, actor and musician Jared Leto was often the new kid in school. Find out what he suggests kids and schools do to help.

59.title: Jamie Lee Curtis - Parenting
59.plot: How are children like paparazzi? An insight for parents from mother, actress and author Jamie Lee Curtis.

60.title: Salma Hayek - Find It Within Yourself
60.plot: What happens when we focus too much on other people's praise and criticism? Advice from actress Salma Hayek.

61.title: Lily Collins - Follow Your Intuition
61.plot: Have you ever had a gut feeling that someone needs help? Have you ever felt awkward about approaching someone you don't know? Advice from actress Lily Collins.

62.title: Nina Dobrev - Bad Day
62.plot: Find out how a passing stranger transformed a really bad day at school for Vampire Diaries star Nina Dobrev.

63.title: Jason Collins - Expert at Blocking
63.plot: How does NBA player Jason Collins handle rumors, gossip and personal attacks? Advice based on his experience with negative comments both in person and online.

64.title: Melissa Joan Hart - Apologize
64.plot: Wish you could take back something you've done or said? A solution from actress Melissa Joan Hart.

65.title: Missy Franklin - Be Friendly
65.plot: What easy things can you do to help new or isolated kids? And how can it end up helping you too? Ideas from Olympic gold medalist Missy Franklin.

66.title: John Green - What to Do
66.plot: Does it help to bully bullies? Thoughts and a solution from the best-selling author of The Fault in Our Stars.

67.title: Wayne Gretzky - New Kid
67.plot: When hockey legend Wayne Gretzky moved to Toronto at the age of 14, he felt isolated from his family and friends. Find out what helped him through this difficult time.

68.title: Jason Mraz - You Can Help
68.plot: How can talking to a target about the bully's perspective help? Thoughts on ways to support someone who is getting picked on from singer / songwriter Jason Mraz.

69.title: Kenny Ortega - One Person
69.plot: Ever feel like your one voice can't make a difference to a person who is struggling? Director and choreographer Kenny Ortega reflects on the solo voices that have impacted his life.

70.title: Danica Patrick - Positive Interaction
70.plot: What is something easy you can do when you see someone alone in the lunchroom? Advice from auto racing driver Danica Patrick.

71.title: Raghava KK - Not About You
71.plot: Looking back as an adult on the bullying he experienced, he had an insight that could have helped him when he was a target. Find out what this world-famous artist and cartoonist finally realized.

72.title: Gavin de Becker - Roles
72.plot: What really happens when bullies are confronted? Insights from the nation's leading expert on the prediction and management of violence.

73.title: Tony Robbins - Stand Up Online
73.plot: How can you be a leader online? How easy is it to start a positive trend that puts a stop to cyberbullying? Advice from motivational speaker and author Tony Robbins.

74.title: Kevin Spacey - New Kids
74.plot: Actor Kevin Spacey had moved ten times by middle school, and always being the new kid was tough. How can finding an activity you love make you feel confident and at home anywhere?

75.title: Jamie Lee Curtis - Virtual Inclusion
75.plot: Have a few seconds to help someone you see being harassed online? Award-winning actress Jamie Lee Curtis has a tip for you.

76.title: Salma Hayek - Pity the Bully
76.plot: What causes someone to bully? Thoughts from actress Salma Hayek.

77.title: Nina Dobrev - Effects of Bullying
77.plot: What kind of ripple effects does bullying have? How far does the negative energy reach? Thoughts and solutions from actress Nina Dobrev.

78.title: Jason Collins - Defense Tactics
78.plot: If you are struggling with bullying, should you talk to anyone about it? Advice from NBA player Jason Collins.

79.title: Melissa Joan Hart - Keyboard Warriors
79.plot: How does actress Melissa Joan Hart deal with mean comments online? Thoughts on handling negativity.

80.title: Missy Franklin - Meet New People
80.plot: What great things can happen when you step outside your clique or social group? Thoughts from Olympic gold medalist Missy Franklin.

81.title: John Green - Courage
81.plot: Scared to step in and help when you see someone being bullied? So was he. Thoughts from the best-selling author of The Fault in Our Stars.

82.title: Wayne Gretzky - Nice Goes a Long Way
82.plot: Hockey legend Wayne Gretzky tells a story about his grandfather and reflects on how kindness shapes our lives.

83.title: Jason Mraz - Stay True Be You
83.plot: If your differences are drawing the attention of bullies, why stay true to them? Thoughts from singer / songwriter Jason Mraz.

84.title: Kenny Ortega - It's Like Tai Chi
84.plot: What can you do when negative energy comes at you? Tai Chi wisdom from an award-winning director and choreographer.

85.title: Danica Patrick - Two Sides of Social Media
85.plot: Friending. Liking. Fans. Are there any dangers to craving and thriving on positive attention online? Thoughts from auto racing driver Danica Patrick.

86.title: Raghava KK - Defuse the Situation
86.plot: Can a stranger stop a bullying episode with a few tactful words? A story from a world-famous artist and cartoonist.

87.title: Gavin de Becker - Bully also Suffering
87.plot: What kind of help does a bully need? Advice from the nation's leading expert on the prediction and management of violence.

88.title: Tony Robbins - More Than This Moment
88.plot: What thought about the future can help as you struggle with bullying? Advice from motivational speaker and author Tony Robbins.

89.title: Kevin Spacey - Empathy
89.plot: What does it really feel like to be a target? What does it really feel like to be a bully? Thoughts on the power of imagination and empathy from House of Cards star Kevin Spacey.

90.title: Salma Hayek - It's Not You
90.plot: Actress Salma Hayek shares a story about watching a boy verbally attack her daughter. How did her daughter's reaction surprise her?

91.title: Nina Dobrev - Get in There
91.plot: Why help when you see someone being bullied? Thoughts on first steps to reducing bullying from actress Nina Dobrev.

92.title: Jason Collins - Sports as an Outlet
92.plot: What lessons can be learned about the value of differences from a look at the most successful sports teams? Thoughts from NBA player Jason Collins.

93.title: John Green - Reach Out
93.plot: How can reaching out to isolated kids help you? Insight and advice from the best-selling author of The Fault in Our Stars.

94.title: Kenny Ortega - If You Can't Speak Up
94.plot: What should you do if you feel you can't step in? There is always a safe way to help. Suggestions and thoughts on the importance of taking action from award-winning director and choreographer Kenny Ortega.

95.title: Gavin de Becker - Not in the Workplace
95.plot: Should parents and teachers let kids handle it on their own? Advice from the nation's leading expert on the prediction and management of violence.

96.title: Tony Robbins - Buddy Benches
96.plot: Motivational speaker and author Tony Robbins discusses an initiative started by students at several schools that has become popular with students of all types seeking new connections.

97.title: Salma Hayek - End Negativity
97.plot: What does actress Salma Hayek challenge you to give up for a month?

98.title: Kenny Ortega - Kenny's Hero
98.plot: Director and choreographer Kenny Ortega reflects on the help he received from a few important heroes during the years he was bullied. Find out what was different about their techniques, and the same about their results.

99.title: Tony Robbins - Difference Is Coolness
99.plot: Do you feel out of place or get bullied because you're different? Find out what kind of talent, success and happiness motivational speaker Tony Robbins has seen grow from embracing differences.

100.title: Salma Hayek - Don't Be a Bystander
100.plot: Should you wait until the bullying is over to help? What if it doesn't feel safe to step in? Solutions for intervening from actress Salma Hayek.

101.title: Kenny Ortega - Grandma's Rule
101.plot: Director and choreographer Kenny Ortega shares his grandmother's rule.

102.title: Kenny Ortega - Rumors
102.plot: What question should you ask yourself when you hear a rumor? How can gossip hurt? Thoughts from High School Musical director and choreographer Kenny Ortega.

103.title: Kenny Ortega - When You Bully
103.plot: Are you hurting inside and taking out your frustration on someone else? Advice from director and choreographer Kenny Ortega.

1.title: Kevin Spacey - Confronting Them
1.plot: Ever notice how people try to stay out of a mean kid's way and will only talk about what a drag it is when he or she is not around? Find out how House of Cards star Kevin Spacey handles bullying behavior on the set.

2.title: Jared Leto - Owning Yourself
2.plot: As a kid, actor and musician Jared Leto says he was pretty different himself. Find out what he has to say to kids who feel they don't fit in.

3.title: Michael J. Fox - Bystanders
3.plot: How can you help someone who is bullied or stereotyped for their differences? Advice from actor Michael J. Fox, who lives with Parkinson's disease.

4.title: Elizabeth Banks - Cyber Hero
4.plot: Think celebrities don't care about the mean comments people write about them online? Think again. Actress and producer Elizabeth Banks shares insight into how a kind post from anyone can make a difference to targets online.

5.title: Jamie Lee Curtis - Rumors
5.plot: A friend tries to share some juicy gossip with you. What do you say? A solution from an award-winning actress who knows how it feels to be the target of rumors.

6.title: Akon - Stand by Them
6.plot: How can you support someone during a bullying incident? A suggestion from singer / songwriter Akon.

7.title: Salma Hayek - Own Your Mistakes
7.plot: What can you say when someone teases you about a mistake? Suggestions from actress Salma Hayek.

8.title: Demi Lovato - Cyberbullying
8.plot: Recording artist Demi Lovato opens up about her difficult experience with cyberbullying. Find out how she thinks bystanders can help.

9.title: Shailene Woodley - In Their Shoes
9.plot: What can you say if your group of friends is making fun of someone? What words can you use that won't get dismissed or laughed at? Fault in Our Stars actress Shailene Woodley has a suggestion.

10.title: Laura Dern - Citizens of Compassion
10.plot: Why is it worth a little discomfort to help out when you see someone being mistreated? A story and advice from award-winning actress Laura Dern. . .

11.title: Ansel Elgort - Block Them
11.plot: Ever tempted to fight back online? Find out what Fault in Our Stars actor Ansel Elgort did to stop a kid who harassed him in high school-- and how he thinks the story might have ended if he'd taken the bait.

12.title: Lily Collins - Gay Slurs
12.plot: Actress Lily Collins remembers a time when she stood up to a date who used a gay slur in conversation. Thoughts and advice on fears about confrontation.

13.title: Nina Dobrev - Feeling Different
13.plot: What's great about being different? Advice from actress Nina Dobrev.

14.title: Jenna Elfman - Who's Left to Bully
14.plot: Can you use peer pressure for good? Thoughts from actress Jenna Elfman.

15.title: Jason Collins - Wearing a Mask
15.plot: Is there something about yourself that you are hiding from others? NBA player Jason Collins recalls his struggles being a closeted gay athlete, and shares his encouragement and advice.

16.title: Lawrence Kasdan - Heroes
16.plot: How easy is it to be a hero in your own daily life? Thoughts from the award-winning screenwriter of Star Wars and Raiders of the Lost Ark. . .

17.title: Tom Brady - Anti Bullying
17.plot: Should players blame a teammate for a loss? How can you support someone who is being mistreated, either on or off the field? Advice from NFL player Tom Brady.

18.title: Melissa Joan Hart - Words Hurt
18.plot: Words are like toothpaste. Hear the analogies actress Melissa Joan Hart uses to teach her kids about the power of words.

19.title: Rita Wilson - Speaking Up
19.plot: What feels worse than the fear of speaking up? Thoughts from actress and singer Rita Wilson.

20.title: Billie Jean King - Social Media
20.plot: How can you use social media to help? Suggestions from tennis legend Billie Jean King.

21.title: Chad Smith - Being Different
21.plot: Red Hot Chili Peppers drummer Chad Smith talks about two key solutions he sees for kids who feel they don't fit in or are being bullied for their differences.

22.title: Missy Franklin - Tall Girl
22.plot: Has anyone said something negative about you that has stuck with you for years? Find out what a boy in elementary school said about Olympic gold medalist Missy Franklin, and what helped her change her mind about what it meant to her.

23.title: Olivia Holt - Isolation
23.plot: How can you help someone you see feeling left out? Actress Olivia Holt shares a story of how one person made a difference for her.

24.title: Neil Gaiman - Different Is Good
24.plot: Ever wish you could change something about yourself? A prediction from best-selling author and screenwriter Neil Gaiman.

25.title: John Green - Cyberbullying
25.plot: Do people ever say terrible things about you online? Find out what this best-selling author does when negative comments hurt his feelings.

26.title: Nat Wolff - Be Inclusive
26.plot: Do you know a kid who has trouble socially and gets picked on for it? So did Fault in Our Stars actor Nat Wolff. Find out what he did, and what he suggests.

27.title: Wayne Gretzky - Bigger Kids
27.plot: Hockey legend Wayne Gretzky was picked on for being smaller and younger than his teammates. Find out what he did.

28.title: Vanessa Marano - Bystander Friends
28.plot: Actress Vanessa Marano shares her own experience as a bystander in school. Find out what worked for her.

29.title: Jillian Michaels - Bystanders
29.plot: Are there small things you can do to help if you see someone being bullied? Tips from America's Health and Wellness Expert Jillian Michaels.

30.title: Jason Mraz - Gay Slurs
30.plot: Your friend uses an anti-gay slur: what do you say? What words can you use to discourage it and do something to help change the culture? Suggestions from singer / songwriter Jason Mraz.

31.title: Kenny Ortega - Foster Kid
31.plot: When laughter on the set of High School Musical turned mean, award-winning director and choreographer Kenny Ortega stepped in. Find out how he managed to help everyone involved.

32.title: Amanda Palmer - Internet
32.plot: How much might you help with a few positive words online? Insight from singer / songwriter Amanda Palmer.

33.title: Danica Patrick - Those Words Can't Hurt Me
33.plot: People say a lot of really mean things about her online. How does auto racing driver Danica Patrick handle it?

34.title: Raghava KK - Contextualize
34.plot: Negative comments. Hate mail. Find out how this world-famous artist and cartoonist deals with it.

35.title: Gavin de Becker - A Single Word
35.plot: What are the universal warning signs in every student who commits a mass shooting? What simple actions stopped people who considered committing acts of violence? Insights from the leading expert on the prediction and management of violence.

36.title: Tony Robbins - Understand and Defend
36.plot: Motivational speaker and author Tony Robbins shares a story and insights from his experience working with bullies and gang leaders.

37.title: George Stroumboulopoulos - Empathy
37.plot: What class does this award-winning Canadian talk show host think every high school should teach?

38.title: Sam Trammell - Talk to the Bully
38.plot: What would happen if people focused more on trying to help the bully? Thoughts from True Blood star Sam Trammell.

39.title: Dr. Ruth - On Bullying
39.plot: What can you say to someone who's teasing you? And should you get help if it's bothering you? Advice from world famous sex therapist Dr. Ruth Westheimer.

40.title: Colum McCann - Language
40.plot: What words are stronger than the ones bullies use to hurt? Thoughts on the power of language from award-winning author Colum McCann.

41.title: Dr. Philip Zimbardo - The Bystander Effect
41.plot: What keeps people from helping when others are being mistreated? Answers and a solution from a famous psychologist and expert on the Bystander Effect.

42.title: Kevin Spacey - Distractions
42.plot: Can trying to imagine the feelings of others help you avoid regret? Advice from House of Cards star Kevin Spacey.

43.title: Jared Leto - Make Amends
43.plot: Can you recover from a mistake? Is it too late to change yourself and your reputation? Advice from actor and musician Jared Leto.

44.title: Michael J. Fox - Suicides
44.plot: What are the warning signs of a child who is struggling? Thoughts from parent, actor and author Michael J. Fox.

45.title: Elizabeth Banks - Fear vs. Love
45.plot: How do you feel when you know in your gut that something is wrong? What happens when you overcome your fear about doing something to help? Thoughts from actress and producer Elizabeth Banks.

46.title: Jamie Lee Curtis - Share
46.plot: Award-winning actress and author Jamie Lee Curtis draws on her experience with alcoholism and drug addiction to offer insight and a solution for those who are struggling.

47.title: Akon - Regret
47.plot: Can bullying become a habit? Advice on change and avoiding regret from singer / songwriter Akon.

48.title: Salma Hayek - You Can Overcome
48.plot: Have you made a mistake? Are you going through a hard time? Advice from actress Salma Hayek.

49.title: Demi Lovato - Save a Life
49.plot: She was ganged up on in the locker room, then chased into hiding in a bathroom stall. A story and advice for bystanders and targets from multi-platinum recording artist Demi Lovato.

50.title: Shailene Woodley - Rumors
50.plot: What's behind rumors and cyberbullying among teen girls? What can you think about before forwarding that catty message? Thoughts from Fault in Our Stars actress Shailene Woodley.

51.title: Laura Dern - Mr. Moh
51.plot: What would happen if you were able to have no reaction, inside or out, to what a bully is saying about you? Martial arts wisdom from actress and parent Laura Dern.

52.title: Ansel Elgort - Middle School
52.plot: Are you a frequent target for bullying at your school? So was Fault in Our Stars actor Ansel Elgort. Find out what he did that helped him through a really rough period.

53.title: Lily Collins - Rumors
53.plot: What can you say to your friends to stop the rumor and gossip habit? Solutions from actress Lily Collins.

54.title: Nina Dobrev - Pixie Haircut
54.plot: When actress Nina Dobrev got a pixie hair cut in middle school, she was called a boy and taunted by classmates. Find out who stuck up for her and how.

55.title: Jenna Elfman - Goodness Travels Faster
55.plot: What happens when you befriend a target? Advice from actress Jenna Elfman.

56.title: Jason Collins - Homophobia in Sports
56.plot: NBA player Jason Collins shares his experience as a gay professional athlete, and thoughts on how changing reactions to slurs and stereotypes in the industry are affecting the culture.

57.title: Lawrence Kasdan - Be Decent
57.plot: Has something small ever flipped your day from light to dark? Has anyone ever flipped it back again? Thoughts from the award-winning screenwriter of Star Wars and Raiders of the Lost Ark.

58.title: Melissa Joan Hart - Bullied
58.plot: Actress Melissa Joan Hart was bullied as a teen because she was a late bloomer. Find out what would have made a difference to her during this tough time.

59.title: Rita Wilson - Stopping Rumors
59.plot: Ever wonder what to say when a friend shares a rumor about someone you know? Find out how actress and singer Rita Wilson handles it.

60.title: Billie Jean King - Be a Protector
60.plot: What can bigger kids do to help smaller kids and kids who are getting picked on? Solution from tennis legend Billie Jean King.

61.title: Chad Smith - Son's Bus Story
61.plot: What can parents do to increase the odds that their kids will share problems with them? And how can they help when problems arise? A story and advice from Red Hot Chili Peppers drummer Chad Smith.

62.title: Missy Franklin - Gossip
62.plot: Rumors. How can you stop it when your friends bring them up? Ideas from Olympic swimmer Missy Franklin.

63.title: Olivia Holt - Rumors
63.plot: What can you say or do when friends try to share gossip and rumors? Advice from actress Olivia Holt.

64.title: Neil Gaiman - Spitting Story
64.plot: What can you do if you find yourself caught up in the cruel behavior of a crowd? A story and advice from best-selling author and screenwriter Neil Gaiman.

65.title: John Green - Good Internet
65.plot: How can going online help you if you're feeling isolated by your differences at school? Advice from the best-selling author of The Fault in Our Stars, who is co-creator of the Nerdfighter Community.

66.title: Nat Wolff - Facebook
66.plot: Find out what annoying thing actor Nat Wolff's parents did that helped keep him out of drama at school.

67.title: Wayne Gretzky - Be Inclusive
67.plot: Hockey legend Wayne Gretzky offers advice to parents about teaching their children to be kind and inclusive.

68.title: Jillian Michaels - About Them
68.plot: Why do people bully? Thoughts from America's Health and Wellness Expert Jillian Michaels.

69.title: Jason Mraz - Jason's Experience
69.plot: Why share your personal bullying story? Thoughts from singer / songwriter Jason Mraz, and his own story of a childhood friend who bullied him verbally and physically.

70.title: Kenny Ortega - As a Gay Man
70.plot: Director and choreographer Kenny Ortega expresses his pride in how much has changed for gay men and women in his lifetime and in his industry, and shares advice for those who are struggling.

71.title: Amanda Palmer - End the Hate
71.plot: Ever noticed how much time you spend judging? Thoughts from singer / songwriter Amanda Palmer on what can happen when you stop.

72.title: Danica Patrick - England
72.plot: What can you do when you know people are making fun of you behind your back? A story and solutions from auto racing driver Danica Patrick.

73.title: Raghava KK - Creativity and Exposure
73.plot: What is the key ingredient in solutions for bullies, bystanders, and targets? Thoughts from a world-famous artist and cartoonist.

74.title: Gavin de Becker - Jeffrey and Mick
74.plot: A tragic story of a violent revenge attack on a bully with plenty of followers. What could have helped? Reflections from the nation's leading expert on the prediction and management of violence.

75.title: Tony Robbins - Highschool Reunion
75.plot: Motivational speaker and author Tony Robbins recounts his experience being bullied for being smaller and poorer. Find out which coping strategies he tried that he wouldn't recommend, and which ones helped.

76.title: George Stroumboulopoulos - Cyberbullying
76.plot: How can conversation with friends help you deal with cyberbullying? Thoughts from award-winning Canadian talk show host George Stromboulopoulos.

77.title: Sam Trammell - Mob Mentality
77.plot: Is there one kid at your school who gets picked on by almost everyone? Could it be just as easy to get the crowd to go along with something different? Thoughts from Fault in Our Stars actor Sam Trammel.

78.title: Colum McCann - Empathy
78.plot: What would you see if you tried to imagine what was making your bully unhappy enough to mistreat you? Thoughts from award-winning author Colum McCann.

79.title: Dr. Philip Zimbardo - The Evil of Inaction
79.plot: Ever feel yourself hesitate to help when someone is being mistreated? Insights on what is going on from a famous psychologist and founder of the Heroic Imagination Project.

imdb.title: Bystander Revolution
plot: Simple acts of kindness, courage, and inclusion anyone can use to take the power out of bullying.::Anonymous
